Package com.flag4j.operations.concurrency

Class CheckConcurrent

java.lang.Object
com.flag4j.operations.concurrency.CheckConcurrent
public final class CheckConcurrent extends Object
A class which contains methods for determining if a concurrent algorithm should be applied.

  • Constructor Details

    • CheckConcurrent

  • Method Details

    • simpleMatrixCheck

      public static boolean simpleMatrixCheck​(int numRows, int numCols)
      Applies a simple check to determine if a concurrent algorithm should be applied.
      Parameters:
      numRows - Number of rows in matrix.
      numCols - Number of columns in matrix.
      Returns:
      True if a concurrent algorithm should be used. False if a single thread algorithm should be used.

    • relaxedCheck

      public static boolean relaxedCheck​(int numRows, int numCols)
      Applies a check to determine if a concurrent algorithm should be applied. This method is similar to simpleMatrixCheck(int, int) but uses more relaxed parameters.
      Parameters:
      numRows - Number of rows in the matrix.
      numCols - Number of columns in the matrix.
      Returns:
      True if a concurrent algorithm should be used. Otherwise, returns false.

    • standardCheck

      private static boolean standardCheck​(int numRows, int numCols, int baseThreshold, int smallerThreshold, int largerThreshold)
      Applies a standard check to determine if a concurrent algorithm should be used for some operation.
      Parameters:
      numRows - Number of rows in the matrix.
      numCols - Number of columns in the matrix.
      baseThreshold - Base threshold. If both numRows and numCols is greater than this value, then this method will return true.
      smallerThreshold - Smaller threshold.
      largerThreshold - Larger threshold.
      Returns:
      True if a concurrent algorithm should be used.
